sentence.Network_en: He was stricken at twenty-one with a crippling malady.
He tried the baths there for an internal malady.
sentence.Network_cn: 他到那儿洗温泉对他的内科病进行浴疗.

sentence.Network_en: Malaria is a kind of serious malady.
sentence.Network_cn: 疟疾是一种严重的疾病.

list.abs: governement procurement is a non-tariff trade barrier and , to some degree , can lead to social maladies like bribery and embezzlement .政府采购是一种非关税的贸易障碍，在某种程度上可导致社会弊病，如受贿、盗用公款。
Cancer and tuberculosis are serious maladies in every country ., 癌症和肺结核在每个国家都是严重的疾病.
对某物敏感is allergic to something慢性疾病chronic maladies疯牛症mad cow disease

I've recently spoken very directly students about a malady afflicts a certain small percentage of students in that final run of days that lead to the big one : graduation DAY .在毕业日来临前的日子里，有一种疾病正侵袭着一部分同学生。最近和我的几个学生很直接了当地谈到了这个问题。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French maladie, from malade 'sick', based on Latin male 'ill' + habitus 'having (as a condition')

entry.def: A malady is an illness or disease.

example.ex: He was stricken at twenty-one with a crippling malady.

entry.tran: (书面语中，指社会、环境等的)严重问题，弊病，弊端
entry.def: In written English, people sometimes use maladies to refer to serious problems in a society or situation.

example.ex: When apartheid is over the maladies will linger on.
example.tran: 废除了种族隔离政策后痼疾依然存在。

means.word_mean: 2. impairment of normal physiological function affecting part or all of an organism

means.word_mean: (制度或机构的)弊病, 弊端

sentences.en: Violent crime is one of the maladies affecting modern society.
sentences.cn: 暴力犯罪是为害现代社会的弊病之一。
